perturbation.original_text:
7.2      All actions, cases, suits and proceedings in connection with
                  this Agreement shall be brought in Maryland. All persons
                  affected by this Agreement specifically consent to the
                  personal jurisdiction of and venue in said courts. No action,
                  case, suit or proceeding, regardless of form, arising out of
                  or related to this Agreement, may be brought by either party
                  more than one (1) year after the cause of action has arisen, or in the case of nonpayment, more than two (2) years from the date of the last payment. ALL ACTIONS, CASES, SUITS AND
                  PROCEEDINGS SHALL BE HEARD WITHOUT A JURY. ALL PERSONS
                  AFFECTED BY THIS AGREEMENT SPECIFICALLY WAIVE ALL RIGHT TO A
                  TRIAL BY JURY AND SPECIFICALLY CONSENT TO THE PERSONAL
                  JURISDICTION OF AND VENUE IN SAID COURTS.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.2      All actions, cases, suits and proceedings in connection with
                  this Agreement shall be brought in Maryland. All persons
                  affected by this Agreement specifically consent to the
                  personal jurisdiction of and venue in said courts. No action,
                  case, suit or proceeding, regardless of form, arising out of
                  or related to this Agreement, may be brought by either party
                  more than one (1) year after the cause of action has arisen, or in the case of nonpayment, more than two (2) years from the date of the last payment.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of the jury trial waiver clause introduces a legal contradiction. Under Maryland law, the right to a jury trial is constitutionally protected. While a party can knowingly and voluntarily waive this right, its explicit removal from the contract potentially leads to disputes about whether the waiver was indeed knowing and voluntary. Furthermore, some jurisdictions require specific language or a separate, signed agreement for a jury trial waiver to be enforceable, making this omission legally risky. The original clause was an attempt to create such a waiver. Removing it entirely means the contract doesn't address jury trials, increasing the risk of facing one.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Maryland Constitution, Declaration of Rights, Article 23; Maryland Rules of Procedure, Rule 2-325
